channel.title: Logs on Dang-Khoa's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Logs on Dang-Khoa's blog

item.title: Analysis of Algorithms
item.description: A Galactic Algorithms How do we analyze an algorithm Implement a correct and good code of the algorithm. Select the cost model for the algorithm, e.g, comparisons or other costs. The cost model should be independent from the implementation. Decide the input model, e.g, randomness and other properties. Build mathematics models of the algorithms [The hard part]. Break down the operations in the algorithm. Formulate a mathematical problem.

item.title: C++ is better than C
Estimate object size from a reference object
item.description: Estimating object’s area by multiple images My main idea is to use essential matrix or maybe fundamental matrix to find the relationship between the image coordinate and the real world coordinate. There are two main problems which makes me struggle alot: How is the essential matrix if two cameras are diffent? Specicially, if two cameras have two distinct focal lengths and distortions, how we can formulate the relationship matrix between them?

item.title: Crytocurrency Technology
item.description: Crytographic Hash Function A mathematic function: Input: any string Output: fixed-size output (usually 256 bits) Efficiently computable Properties: Collision-free It is very difficult to find $x$ and $y$ for a crytographic hash function such that: $ x\neq y {\text and} H(x)= H(y)$ What is a quantitative measures for difficult level to find a collision? One method: try $2^130$ randomly chosen inputs, we can got 99.8% chance of collision.

item.title: The Josephus problem
item.description: The Josephus problem is one of the famous problem in Concrete Mathematics since the authors used the problem throught several chapters, especially in Chapter 1 and Chapter 3 when the authors intruduce the recurrence relations. Firstly, let express the problem and dicuss several variants.

item.title: Extend CVPR17 paper to the journal version
item.description: Logs 2017-12-19 Update the supervised version of sah. 2017-12-21 The data is damn huge and hence I am not able to store all conv5 features into a cell. Therefore, I decide to split data into 3 parts, namely training set, testing test while extracting. 2018-01-08 anh Tuan’s experiment results % OXFORD5k % Params: L=32 gamma=10.000000 mu=1000000000.000000 lambda=0.010000 beta=0.100000 MAP = 0.135326 % Params: L=32 gamma=10.000000 mu=100000000.000000 lambda=0.010000 beta=0.100000 MAP = 0.

item.title: StayingFit
item.description: Content What’s my motivation? The first assignment in the course is to describe the motivation why I enrolled the class? My respond is to gain more energy for other activities such as efficient working, research. I feel that I got exhausted easily and was not able to work in a long period. Physical Exercise and Guidelines Benefits Emotional Benefits Improved coping skills. Hell Happier! Imroved cognition. Better overall mood.
